reviews.review_msg: This course is hard.  His notes are pretty good but some things I just didn't get in the course.

Really bad prof...recommend you take anyone but him...really hard midterms/finals...really bad notes...doesn't care about students and there success..avg for midterm was 40% but instead of helping students and maybe changing the way he taught to better explain materials he just seemed very indifferent
His lectures are a waste of time.  He blasts through the material without properly explaining things, and belittles people who ask questions.  "I have 5 more minutes..." - no you don't, Imen.

His notes are very unclear. It's better to read the textbook instead. He likes to jump from chapters to chapters. Incredibly challenging exams and there are one/two challenging questions in every assignment. His lectures are impossible to follow because he takes v. little time to explain the complicated stuffs. He makes a hard course even tougher!
Very difficult midterm and assignments. A very demanding but helpful prof.
Justin is a good prof. Math 232 is not easy, but he makes it as clear as possible, which could make you understand linear algebra quickly.
Super nice guy. And has very clear lecture notes. But requires a lot of work to do.. Do the homework and you will be fine.
final is harder than homework... just read the textbook, u ll be good. lectures are boring and useless.
Really good prof, if you work hard on your final and has a significant improvement, he will push your grade!GOOD PROF, exam is fairly.
Very straight forward and organized class. Gets to the point and teaches what needs to be taught and nothing else. Very neutral person.

Justin is a great professor. He is not arrogant as some tend to be. He grades his students quite fairly if he sees you put in the effort on quizzes and he sees improvement. Highly recommended for any math course he's teaching.
yeah, he's hot, but so boring.  soo soo boring.  so slow too.  talks so slow that he makes you fall asleep.  lectures are pretty worthless. can just learn from text yourself.

stop showing up to class after his monotone voice bored me to death. He copied outta the book anyways. Easy exams though. DOn't know what ya'll are complaining about. And yes, i asked a bunch of girls and they all said he was hot. One of my friends says
there is black and there is white... and there is gray!
Monotone lectures, hard to stay awake. He midterms tend to focus more on proof.
He is very cute, but not his exams.  If you want an eyecandy, take the course.  If you want an easy credit, avoid him at all cost..enough said...
He's a reasonably good lecturer, but he expects WAY too much. Tests are 95% based on proofs, and the rest definitions. Non-math majors should probably steer clear, at least for Math 232.
hot but he can't teach! can't believe he asked DEFINITIONs in a MATH exam!!!! going to lectures are basically useless;luckily,the textbook helps!
Notes and lecture quite clear. Exams seems pretty hard, he likes proof and definitions a lot. Take care.
Lectures are entertaining and easy to follow but she makes lots of mistakes. Course material is pretty straight forward. As long as youre on top of practice questions you'll be fine.

She's very passionate about teaching but her lectures tend to be unorganized and she'll often make errors in her notes. Other than that, she's pretty good at teaching the course. Quizzes were simple and midterms were fair. Final exam was also significantly easier that the previous tests.

Marni is passionate about Linear Algebra, but she isn't the best at teaching. Lectures aren't organized very well, felt a little rushed most of the times. Tests are easy and reasonable. Actually study for your quizzes, understand the concepts, and you will be fine.

Right before the final as I walked by her she looked me in the eyes and then started talking to a TA about how all the calculus students had a dead look in their eyes. Her lectures were pretty good, engaged with the students a lot, and I felt like the tests were fair. Only giving a low rating because i am mad i had to write this final after calc.
Lectures are a little messy at times, highly recommended to do practice outside of class with the material. Quizzes taken directly from homework, very easy exams.

Dr. Marni Mishna is a great professor. She explained her lectures very clear with working on examples in details. She was very honest if she herself was confused about some concepts, but she was able to work on them and explain clearly. It was very amazing that she inspired and encouraged students to ask questions. She was serious and kind.

Goes EXTREMELY fast in her lectures. However, she is helpful in the algebra workshop. Make sure you understand and clarify any concepts because the next lecture is going to build off of the previous one.  Quizzes easy, first two midterms were fair, but final was extremely hard (the last third of the course is on another level in general).

here is the thing, you have to learn this course by yourself, or you will fail this course.  she didn't even know what she is talking about.  do not try to follow her lecture, 2 slides  two chapters. just study on your own. and you will get a great grade.

She tries way too hard to be funny when she should be more clear during her lectures. Seems rushed since most classes we got off about 7-10 min early. Sometimes doesn't even work through examples, which is frustrating because she says "try it yourself". Quizzes are really hard, but class is manageable.

The quizzes are grading tough but midterm and final are not. But still, exams are hard, although her teaching skill is good. She speak so fast but with very clear voice even I am a Chinese can easily understand.

I don't know if I have a bone to pick with the Prof, or SFU for making this class so difficult. Basically the amount of work involved in this class is ridiculous. It should be 2 courses because the class is not that difficult, and it's fundamental to anyone in Engineering of Computer Science. Her lectures are almost useless.

You need to spend time and understand the topics yourself as the lectures are not just enough. If you are not up to date with your stuff, you might be sitting in class and have no idea whats going on.
She is too fast in her lecture, does not care if we understand the material, all she care's about is finishing the material by the end of the semester.
Go to Lecture. Do practice questions. No reason you won't get a better grade than you would with any  other professor teaching Math232 at SFU.
Curving* not cutting
Unwanted prof at sfu

This was my toughest course so far into my degree, but also one I learned the most from. It's improved the way I think about math, and in general sharpened my critical thinking skills. If you're actually willing to put in 2-3 hours for reviewing the material from each lecture, take this course with JF. You'll have to work hard, but it's worth it.
Really good teacher, cares a lot about students. Very engaging.

Hard to understand his class notes, but if you go to his office hours, he is helpful. Math 232 is pretty much a subject that needs a lot of self-learning, so don't expect him to teach you everything. His grading is reasonable, and if you think you can get more marks, just talk to him. Also, late email response time as well.
Never uploaded class notes. Hard to read his hand writing. Hard to catch the lecture notes.

He is truly *not* nice to students and the only time he's being clear is during his office hours. He actually gets annoyed when he finds that not many students come to class and ignores students who do. He's quite fake, if you have known him from the beginning of the semester to the end you'll agree with me. Likes to blame students. Be warned.

His lectures are very rushed. If you want to pass you have to go through the textbook as he doesn't cover much in class and skips through a lot of material. He is VERY judgmental which makes a lot of students like me, scared to ask questions. It's very clear that he doesn't care about his students as people, unlike other instructors I have had.

i would like to say that this guy is not bad, but absolutely is not a good prof. So many stuff you need to do before and after classes. The lectures are very rushed, you will not learn anything if you don't prepare. The quizzes and midterms are rush too!!! Don't select this guy if you have other options!!!

I have been very successful in all my courses, but this one is an absolute struggle. Math isn't even the issue, the lecture style is just unhelpful as it's completely rushed and we are supposed to already know everything. The prof puts the onus of learning the material on the students and is very intimidating to approach for help. Good luck.

1. Goes through lectures too fast, only covers the basic ideas and not anything you might see on a test. 2. Attitude seems like "its on you guys to learn, not my problem if you fail" seems to blame incompetence and lack of work of students for low averages on tests. (key term: average) 3. Tests are rushed, if you don't know something, skip it.

U have to pay $25 for online assignments which are weighted 10% of the whole course, which didn't happen when I took this course in Fall 2017, so does online assignments help you with better understanding of this course? I don't think so, if doing homeworks online makes you a better student then why do we need a professor? Freaking hilarious.

Avoid at all costs if you can take w/ someone else. Got an A, but it was hell. Midterms were speed tests, blows over material and doesn't provide adequate explanations, and in the very last class he zoomed over an obscure topic with barely any background information and it was on the final. Basically learned on my own through the textbook.

one of the worst profs i've ever had. attending lectures only confused me more. he seems very lazy; he pretty much re-used midterms and even the final. he only changed numbers and a couple questions on the final. after midterms he would go over them... it does not help, the way he solves the problems only made me shake my head. AVOID AT ALL COST!!!

He is a nice guy.However,He went the material so fast that you have to relearn all the material at home.His exam is extremely hard and ridiculously long.He will give u his own style of question that you will never find on your textbook.average for this class is around 48%. So if u are not enjoying in the materials, take it with another prof.
easy material. He is very smart and a good grader :)

Guy sucks at teaching this course. He's very confusing in the lectures and you have to read the text to even grasp the section "taught". Why does he have a job teaching? Seems like a nice guy, but he just should not be an instructor.

he was pissed off if someone studied in class and not listened to him during lecture; may be he should respect his students more; a few times he just shouted across the room and threatened us that he would not delay the quiz at all cost.

I don't understand what he taught during the lecture most of the time. You MUST read/study the textbook at home(on your own) and figure out all the questions he assignment to you. Then, you will get a good grade.

One of the few profs that can teach in an *intuitive* manner. He doesn't care about the details, but gives you the big picture of formulae/expressions. Nice guy but expects you to work too hard. Gives good grades.
He would give you his own applications, not like apps in the textbook, and his apps is hard to understand. He hardly responds your emails, I sent him totally 5 emails but only one was responded

His handwriting is generally illegible and he usually goes too fast. Definitely recommend reading the textbook before going to class. His exams are a little on the difficult side, but always remember to justify everything.
Hes ok, but what the last poster said is right, you wont see anything in class on your midterm!

JF tries to get the material accross but he just can't.  He only goes over the simplest examples in lecture, and does everything so fast that you don't understand the how.  Often says "just stare at it" as an answer but the TA's dont accept this when marking the MT.  Some things he says in lecture if you write on a MT are marked Wrong. Try to avoid
Amazing prof

Justin teaches the content in a concise and clear manner. He is accessible after class and always willing to help, he responds to emails quickly. His midterms are super easy, just do the homework he tells you to and the midterm is essentially a copy of it. Computing assignments are probably the hardest part of the course, so start early.

232 is a difficult course, but he did a good job teaching it. Passionate about the materials in lectures, and is available in long office hours to help out, usually at least 3 hours per week. Pacing of the course is very fast, but it's not the instructor's fault.
Excellent clear prof for linear algebra, is definitiely the guy you wanna have. He is approachable for asking questions and his lectures are clearly organized.

Justin Chan is probably the best math proff I've had in a while. He actually cares about his students and is super approachable. Exams were very fair. Make sure to religiously do the textbook questions over and over if you want to succeed in this course. Highly recommend this guy

Seriously, Justin is the best teacher to learn a brutal subject like linear algebra from. Maybe even better than Brenda Davison. He made his own set of lecture notes to simplify them for normal students to grasp. That alone was a lifesaver. Some students will complain about how hard he controls the class (no talking whatsoever) but I loved it.

His notes are very good and will help you alot, he will answer every question you ask, but please do not ask him stupid/obvious questions that waste class time because his section would fall behind the others constantly. He marked the assignments very generously compared to other sections so free grade boost. Exam/quiz questions were based on textb

Justin tackled each of the 10+ questions asked per lecture willingly and elaborately. Even though he spoke a bit quietly at times, his explanations were generally clear, and, honestly, I enjoyed the 'no talking during the lectures' aspect since it allowed me to focus on the content. TAs marked nicely; email responses were quite prompt.

1. Don't talk (or even whisper) when he's speaking - he will call you out
2. 232 exams hardly had any conceptual problems, so make sure to grind the mechanical textbook problems
3. Justin is a nice guy and does not half-ass with marking and replying to emails
4. Marking seemed generous (at least for my section)
5. Dry but helpful lectures

helpful and kind
meh at teaching, but it's linear algebra after all
unintentionally funny at times, which makes lectures more enjoyable
all assessments are fair game
study well and you'll do great!

Dr. Chan was a good professor who was very responsive to questions and open to office hours. Quizzes and Exams are not hard if you prepare for them. He does have a tick with people talking in his lectures and will stop and call people out but its not that big of a deal and makes sense.
He was constantly making mistakes and having to go back and making excuses for this behaviour. His pacing was all over the place. He was good enough I guess

Justin is a very caring and wholesome prof. There are complaints that he goes too slow but that's because he tries to answer student questions when they come up. His exams are very fair (a bit on the easy side). He doesn't teach 232 often, but if he does then make sure to enroll!

Talks way too slow and causes the class to always be behind. Often over explains concepts that are simple then also does examples for each which wastes time. Watching recorded lectures in 2x speed help a little bit, but overall he's a very nice professor. Always looks in the chat for questions and always asks if are any questions after each concept

Very slow during class, doesn't finish material and relies on pointing you to the textbook to learn. Pauses to read messages in the chat that are not relevant to the course material. Somehow makes easy material difficult to understand as he attempts to make it ambiguous .

Lectures are awfully slow. The class is always behind as he cannot finish the section of notes (ex 1.1) in 1 hour. His assignments are awfully long and sometimes very short. His overall teaching ability is poor as his writing is messy and he tends to be at a pace of talking to a 2 year old. His first midterm was incredibly hard. Very time limited.
Justin is definitely one of the best math professors at SFU. He cares about his students and makes sure they understand the topics clearly. His teaching style is unique and makes math enjoyable.

Justin Chan is a wonderful professor, arguably the best one at SFU. He is friendly, caring, and kind. In lectures, his notes were very organized and his explanations were clear. He genuinely cares about his students, as he stays in the math open lab after every lecture, sometimes even staying past the time when he was supposed to leave.

I was scared of this class at first due to others saying it was brutal, but Justin Chan made this class my GPA booster, HANDS DOWN THE BEST PROF I HAVE EVER ENCOUNTERED AT SFU. He makes tricky concepts extremely easy to understand and his notes are very organized and clear. In addition, he is extremely kind and helpful in the Math Open Lab!

Justin is an amazing professor! He gave us gap notes to fill in and posted everything online. He's super clear during lectures and also extremely accessible (and friendly) outside of lectures (he was almost always at the algebra lab). If you want to do well, take full advantage of the algebra lab and ask as many questions as you can.

TAKE THIS ADVICE SERIOUSLY. Please do not take a class with this woman. Her attitude is brush off and arrogant. She doesn't control her classroom, her notes are a mess and her 50 min tests are 20 questions long. If you don't want to hate math when you finish the semester please listen and avoid at ALL COSTS.
This man cannot teach!!! do not even bother showing up for class. The text book is your best friend if you are forced to take his class. my advice. RUN FAST RUN FAR!!
don't  forget the additional questions on the assignments, most of the quizzes were from additional questions.

Subject is difficulty and need lot of hard work due to which many students blame professor. On the other hand professor teaches very well and you will get good grades if you will work hard in his class.
Love love love this guy. Super nice, though lectures are a little dry. Very patient. Exams were very fair, I studied ~2 days before each exam and got an A+. Only complaint is the awful textbook.

Previous complaints are highly exaggerated. Only made sure to do the assignment questions and study the information in the text based on his notes. Very fair exams. No tricks. People hate on him because he doesn't like people talking during his lectures, but honestly we're there to learn, so what he is asking for is not unreasonable. Great prof.

Good instructor, answers every questions during the lecture. Sometimes made calculation mistakes though.The material itself is a little confusing, but the exams are ok. Just do the assignments and you will get a decent grade.

Good attitude and will answer questions. Lectures can be confusing, even though I go to lectures, I find reading the textbook vital, this could be due to the subject and not him. Midterm and final are very easy if you do all the assignments diligently.
A good course to practice self-learning with the lovely textbook.

Makes linear algebra appear like it is nuclear science, with complicated words and all, when in fact it is not that difficult: very confusing. And also, he does not like students talking during his INCREDIBLY boring lectures; if he catches even one, he will just stare you down for a minute with his idiotic smile.

seriously, he does not know how to teach math232, just keep talking extremely fast in the lecture. Also lecture is useless since even though you attned on the lecture, you will feel much more confuse than you look the textbook at home

going to class makes you more confused than before. Book used this semester is crap; and the final was impossible. avoid the baboon book at all cost, its the worst book ever; and try to find a good prof for linear, its a nice course if u have someone good to teach it
Sucks....really. He dose a lot of mistakes in class and his lecturing is so fast.and he cannot explain well on some of the lecture

He makes a lot of minor mistakes in class, almost every lecture someone calls him on it. On the other hand, he's good at explaining all the really abstract concepts in lin alg, and can always answer questions without needing time to prepare an answer.

exam questions are fair for the most part. his notes are well-prepared and organised. during the second half of the semester, as the concepts become more difficult, he moves a bit too fast, but this can easily be solved by pre-reading the sections. good teacher overall
Great prof

I didn't really try in this course, I slept every class and still came close to the average. His notes were pretty much straight out of the textbook. The homework wasn't hard. The exams were easy if you did all the questions in the textbook.
Really good prof. Explains concepts well. Failed course first time with a different terrible prof and got an A in his class. Def recommend.
Exams were variations of homework questions and simple textbook examples. Assignments were fairly straightforward.
No Comments
No Comments
he just copied down the textbook in the lectures
Lecture notes are more confusing than the textbook.
He doesn't tell you anything that isn't already in the text book...
He hasn't got a clue how to teach
No Comments

This class was pretty hard for the first units because of how different the concept of matrix math is compared to calculus; but after the initial intro units, it gets better. Brenda does her lectures at 1.5x speed so be ready to take notes and actually pay attention.

MATH232 with Professor Davison can be challenging, but her lectures and office hours make it manageable. Definitely use the textbook and do all the homework - it really helps. Unstuck AI was a lifesaver for exam prep too.

Favorite math prof I've had at SFU. Explains things clearly, gets straight to the point, always available to answer questions and truly seems like she cares about you succeeding and understanding. She has a passion for this and it shows, it passed onto me. No one said it's an easy course if you don't put in the work, btw. Thank you so much Brenda.

Pace is really fast and it is very important to grasp the first few week's material since its all built on that. Brenda's pretty good and she has past lecture recordings on youtube. Midterms and final are easier than anticipated.
Good prof, just do the work and you'll get a good grade, this is not a hard class, don't listen to anyone who tells you it is.

She is funny and knowledgeable but linear algebra is just a difficult topic to grasp. She sometimes goes too fast and her work for some examples is hard to follow. Personally, near the end of the course I just stopped trying to understand her lectures and learned from the textbook instead.

She's alright, not the best prof I have had. I felt like she went too fast for some of the materials. However, she is definitely better than few other profs at the math department. You definitely need to put in your own work and practice as much as you can.

Linear algebra was the hardest class the I have ever done. However, Brenda's office hours made Math 232 less stressful. She's a very forgiving person, and does everything she can to pass every. If you want to do well in the course, you'll have to study a lot.

Math 232 is a hard class, not because of the content itself but the content is new and never before seen. However, Brenda makes it bearable through her organization and dedication. She is on time, exams are for the most part, fair and you can tell she wants you to understand the material. This class will require much of your time and dedication.

Dr. Davidson is an excellent professor, if there was a higher rating than 5 she would receive it. She is extremely knowledgeable and passionate. She explains concepts in an engaging way. Her office hours are helpful and you can tell she cares about students. She never hesitates to answer questions either. Take MATH 232 with Dr. Davidson!!

Brenda Davison is a great instructor. If you have the option to take her - do it. 
MATH232 itself is a difficult class, but she explains concepts well and doesn't waste students' time.
Quizzes and assignments are easy and fairly graded. Tests are hard, but still graded fairly.
Do ALL the homework, if possible. It really helps.

Material builds on top of each other and is understandable once enough repetition is done. Professor provided good lectures and slides. Homework is good to do as it allows you to get more practice in and to understand concepts. Tests were also fair. Would take her again for future courses.

Brenda was awesome, but MATH 232 was hard, always be on top of your stuff and pratice ALOT or else its gg for you my friend. Take advantage of her office hours and AW workshops, she and her TA's are veryy knowledgable people. Overall great prof :)

As you probably heard, MATH 232 is not easy, but Brenda was an excellent professor and made the course somewhat enjoyable. My only complaint would be that the biweekly MATLAB assignments felt a little detached from the course as they did not always have to do with exam material. If you want to do well in this course do lots of textbook questions.

Brenda's very passionate about teaching. Midterms were decently hard, but the final was relatively easier. There's lots of homework assigned (not for marks) but practice is definitely needed to do well in the course.

Brenda is absolutely amazing and super knowledgable. She makes concepts crystal clear and always gives extremely detailed, straightforward explanations. There's lots of homework and it moves fast but Brenda is concise and will teach you all the relevant stuff. I also appreciate her humour. MATLAB is easy to learn and exams were tough but fair.
One of the best profs i have had till now, brenda is straight away the best prof for math 232. 232 is an interesting course. Loved it!

Brenda Davison is among the best professors in SFU's Mathematics Department.  What I like most about her is her ability to compress abstract ideas into understandable material using analogies or examples.  Moreover, she is always willing to listen to student concerns, is highly knowledgeable in her field, and is evidently passionate about teaching.

Brenda is an amazing professor. I would recommend her for linear algebra. Midterms can be tricky with a couple proof-type questions, but the final is straightforward and easy for the most part. Do the homework and go to class. These two tips will be more than enough for anyone to do well.
Great professor which explains everything in a very intuitive way (at least to me). Made linear algebra at least bearable.

She is definitely one of the best math professors I've ever had. Explained concepts well, gave straightforward answers when you asked questions, and genuinely cared for students. Most of the questions in exams and quizzes were related to the assignment problems. Definitely possible to get above 80% if you put in an effort.

Mount Rushmore of Math profs alongside Jamie Mulholland of course. Engaging lectures, maybe a bit quick if you aren't familiar with the content, but topics can easily be reviewed before or after class to solidify understanding. Use online lectures on her yt channel, although some are done by randal pyke (try to go to class for those ones.
Class extremely hard, computing assignments extremely over complicated and useless. She was nice but went way too fast in lectures hard to follow.

She was very helpful, understanding, and accommodating but that class was hard. Practice questions are a must but the exams were pretty fair. However, the computing assignments are way harder if you don't have any Matlab experience. W Brenda!.

Good professor, very fair with marking and grading. Final exam and midterms were difficult but very fair exams. She is a bit hard to follow at times during the lecture and seems to go on tangents. Overall she is very knowledgeable with the content and effective at teaching. Just be ready to take notes fast and ask questions when you get lost.

Extremely difficult class and Brenda has some great reviews but honestly, her teaching style wasn't for me. Her notes move very quickly in class and she leaves a lot of sections blank for you to figure out on your own, which can be overwhelming. Her computing assignment criteria was also super confusing. Be studious and maybe you can pass!

This is a really tough class, but Brenda tries her best to communicate the topics in a way it makes sense. She's super forgiving with assignments and quizzes, and does what she can to give the class the most opportunities to improve their grades. Watch her youtube videos if you need more help. And learn some MATLAB before taking this class too....

Considering that this class had more than 400 people in it at the same time, Brenda was a fantastic prof. She was able to explain things to the best ability. She also has online lectures that provide better explanations if you are confused. Do all the quiz assignments and ask questions and you'll be fine. Would take another class with her.

NEVER skip class. Do the homework throughout the week, and don't cram the night before the quizzes. This is an extremely heavy class, so figure out how to manage your time properly. Brenda goes super quickly through the topics so the textbook will be your BFF if you don't understand stuff. Brenda is a decent teacher but is kind of rude to students.

Brenda is an amazing professor who cares a lot about her students' success. This course is very difficult, yet she tries her best to explain things in the time available. Tips: Do not skip class EVER (learned this the hard way after 1st midterm), do the quiz assignments, go to the algebra workshop, understand concepts in your own words. Good luck!

Good prof. However, if you're taking this course with her specifically, just make sure you're not taking another intense/homework heavy course since her quiz assignments have a alot of questions each week. If you don't have previous MATLAB/python knowledge, prepare to do alot of googling to learn about certain functions when doing assignments.

One of the best professors in the math department, her lectures are kind of speedy but she has audio and video notes recorded. Very reasonable professor in terms of the grading. Won't straight up mark you a 0 for some miscalculation unlike some other professors and missed quiz grades get passed onto the final.
Watched her math232 lectures on youtube, saved everyone
Its easy if you dont skip the class or exams.

Amazing prof! One of the best math profs at SFU, with the likes of Jamie Mulholland. Explains content very clearly and you can tell that she knows her stuff. Needed to code in Matlab for the computing assignments, but the code is fairly basic. Very accessible through emails.

Pls do hw and i cant stress this enuf. Was in the 80s for both mts and ended up with a 100 on the final cuz i finally put in the effort. Brenda and the TAs were super helpful too. But,if u dont have prior coding experience, prepare tissues to cry like me on the computing hw. Thank god i survived this class, and would i take linear algebra again? NO

Brenda is a very kind professor. She does a good job of explaining complex topics by using very understandable vocabulary. She also gives great analogies and examples for difficult problems. Although she records her lectures, I think the learning experience is better when you're there. 

The tests are fair but I don't think she doesn't make them.
Professor Davison really cares about how well her students are doing. She explains concepts very well using non-mathematical ways. She is the only reason I enjoyed linear algebra.

Brenda was one of the math best profs I've had so far at sfu. She made concepts easy to understand, super considerate with marking, didnt take too many marks off for dumb mistakes on quizzes to make sure she was testing concepts. All exams were fair and had an excellent scaling scheme. Effort pays off in this class! Would absolutely take again.

Usually explains concepts well, but sometimes goes off on tangents that can get confusing. 4 Matlab assignments, 4 quizzes, 2 midterms, and a final - lots of coursework + keep up with homework. The class itself is difficult, but she's a good option - better than Randall Pyke. Unfortunately, they collaborated for their YouTube lectures.

Great prof with a lot of enthusiasm for the course which really helped me learn. Made hard concepts really easy to understand and gave a generous marking schematic to help students get a grade they deserved. Would highly recommend!

MATH 232 was a pretty difficult course for me but Brenda's lectures were able to let me pull through, though unfortunately half of them were also done by Randall Pyke (not a great prof). She also offers multiple grading schemes and will use the one that will get you the highest grade. Highly recommend.
follow her video you'll do good can't wait to see her in person.
A solid professor who cares a lot about teaching and is very helpful. She certainly makes math courses a more pleasant experience and I would recommend her to anyone taking one.

I was very fortunate to have a highly knowledgeable and experienced professor for the course. I'm afraid the class is a bit over my head. However, Weekly office hours helps a lot. Giftson,and Liam They are the best TA. (I'm not sure if you remember me. Thank you for taking care of us!!! Hope everything goes well with you! 
THANK YOU DR. BRENDA

Brenda Davison's YouTube lectures are the only reason why I have been sorta successful in Bruin's 152 class.

For MATH 232, Grading is tough for Computing assignments but overall reasonable for every other part of the class. Explanations are thorough and in class lectures help clarify the material. In short, great professor and highly recommended.
Hard class but the professor was great.

Brenda Davison was one of the better math profs that I've taken. Her lectures are pretty well done, but frequent and basically mandatory. There are weekly hw assignments, with about 20-25 questions to be done. If you do the hw and maybe an additional hour or 2 of practice, you will breeze through the weekly tests, and maybe even the exams.

Great prof, truly cares about students. The content in this course is tough, but she tries her best to help you. Her lectures are going over questions you have from watching pre-recorded lectures before class. Weekly homework (non-graded) questions are on weekly quiz. Midterms and final are fair. Algebra workshop helps with homework, use it!

Brenda is an amazing prof, as shes alwasy contactable and can answer questions properly and in detail. However, you need to pay attention and undertstand the material, or you'll get lost halfway through. She provided YT vids and did nonmanatory in-person lectures for students. The HW was reasonable and made the course material a bit understandable

good prof, but his exams are really hard, han the final grade is so unfair!

Nancy is an exceptional professor. She marks very fairly, but is still always willing to listen to your grading appeals. Her lecture notes and clear and concise which is also a huge plus. Easy midterms, and easy finals. Midterm 2 was easier than midterm 1

Very fair midterms , and good at explaining concepts

she does not care. always in rush. everything is disorganized and messy. never gives review sessions.

Jas is really nice and patient! Helps a lot if you go to office hours. his note is so messy...which is hard to read...if u want to take his class...read textbook is more helpfull then the class notes....
